error: Failed to load leaderboard. Please check Firebase configuration.
privacyNoticeRequired: Please accept the privacy notice to view the leaderboard...

privacy.title: Alchemist Confidentiality Agreement
privacy.subtitle: ALCHEMIST CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT
privacy.content: We use Firebase anonymous authentication technology. Data is encrypted, and the system only records "nickname" and "total earnings". We never collect real names or geographic locations.
privacy.funnyText: Don't worry, even if you reach "Chief Toilet Officer", your boss will only think you're working hard. On this leaderboard, you're just a legendary code.
privacy.shieldTooltip: Anonymous Protection Active: Data encrypted and synced to cloud laboratory.

levelup.1: The starting point. Right now, you are just a disposable asset.
levelup.2: First step to freedom. You've mastered the art of hiding behind the porcelain throne.
levelup.3: Your skills are verified. Management still hasn't noticed your "disappearing" act.
levelup.4: Officially initiated. The money you earned here can now cover your utility bills.
levelup.5: Your job title is now a verb. The company literally pays for your bio-break.
levelup.6: You know the bathroom better than your own desk. This is your true home.
levelup.7: Professional slacking doesn't need water, just a soundproof stall.
levelup.8: You've achieved "irreplaceability" because no one knows what you do in there.
levelup.9: You are now the company's appendix. Useless, but cutting you out would hurt.
levelup.10: It's not theft anymore; it's a daylight robbery of the company's profit margin.
levelup.11: A miracle occurred. Your bathroom wealth is now impacting the quarterly report.
levelup.12: Legend born! You've transmuted enough to own the stall. You are the King of Toilets.

health_critical: Emergency Room Co-pay | You earned just enough to pay for the ER. Get up, your anus is screaming.
Hemorrhoid Surgery Fund | Keep squatting, the doctor misses you.
Leg Amputation Risk | Can't feel your legs? That's because they're dead.
health_warning: Donut Cushion | You'll need this to sit at your desk tomorrow.
Toilet Seat Imprint (Permanent) | Your butt has fused with the toilet seat.
Boss's Suspicion | Gone so long, your boss thinks you're mining crypto in the bathroom.
wealth_micro: Boss's CO2 | You stole a breath of air from the company. This is the beginning of revenge.
Static Electricity | You took nothing but friction.
Void | Form is emptiness, emptiness is salary.
The Manager's Fake Smile | It's cold, but at least they're too busy to yell at you.
Unread Slack Messages | Escaping is shameful but useful; you've earned five more seconds of peace.
Fingerprints on the Screen | Physical evidence of your hard work, even if it looks like slacking.
A Dead Mouse | It's a sign from above to stare blankly at your desk legitimately.
Water Cooler Bubbles | That 'glug' sound means the company just paid for your elimination process.
Toilet Stall Graffiti | The only social media in the company where you can speak your mind.
Residual Toilet Seat Heat | You took the warmth from the last colleague; that's how traditions are passed.
Untitled Excel Save | Filled with career anxiety and endless emptiness.
Broken Water Dispenser Button | Like your promotion chances, nothing happens when you press it.
The Scent of Photocopies | The smell of capitalism; it smells like your youth burning.
Slack 'Typing...' | They type, they stop, your heart hangs in the balance.
Printer Standby Hum | It's waiting for commands; you're waiting for freedom.
Spinning PDF Icon | Round and round, spinning away your youth.
Worn Mousepad Edge | The trenches of your countless ineffective clicks.
Excel Scroll Bar | Even at the bottom, you won't find the meaning of life.
A Blank Notebook | Like your head, filled with the desire to clock out.
Expired Meeting Invite | Meetings that didn't happen were stolen moments of freedom.
HR's Canned Response | Proof you're still in the system.
Screensaver Motion | Staring at the only universe you can truly control.
Footsteps in the Hall | The sound of capitalism, but it can't cross this door.
Auto-save Icon | Thanks to this split-second lag, giving you an excuse to stop thinking.
Transparent Paperclip Box | Filled with your ineffective constraints on the system.
Expired E-signature | Signed your life away, but the ink is dry.
Broken Water Dispenser Switch | Like your motivation, no passion flows.
#REF! Error in Excel | Your career reference point has been lost.
Blue Screen of Death | The best paid leave God ever gave you.
Greasy Fingerprints on Screen | Blurred reality, but cleared your vision of slacking.
Ignored Group Stickers | A wage slave's last shred of dignity, vanishing in silence.
Expired Keycard | It can't take you anywhere except this prison called work.
Hidden Excel Sheet | Hiding your secrets, which is just today's lunch menu.
Printer Paper Jam Warning | A tiny protest against this boring world.
Missed Anonymous Call | Could be a headhunter, could be a scam, but it was your hope.
Expired Annual Report | After reading it, you still can't afford any of the dreams inside.
Mouse Drag Resistance | A reminder that life's path is full of obstacles.
Vending Machine 'Out of Stock' | Even the machine is telling you today's luck is bad.
Broken 'Esc' Key | Means you can't escape; you must continue alchemy.
Post-it Residue on Screen Edge | Stuck to your past, but can't stick to your future.
PC Heat Output | At least it warms your cold heart in the office.
Expired Zoom Link | Meetings you didn't attend are your fondest memories.
Unclaimed Package List | Might contain freedom, but you're too afraid to claim it.
Expired Firewall Alert | Your mental defenses collapsed; only the toilet remains.
Blue Loading Circle | Spinning away your anxiety, spinning into the void.
Unused Public Folder | Filled with digital dust and your forgotten enthusiasm.
PC Startup Beep | Declaring your labor has been reactivated.
A Gap in the Stall Door | Extreme alchemy in tension and excitement.
Expired Password Reset Hint | You've forgotten who you are, only remembering this salary.
Auto-brightness Adjustment | It knows you're tired, but makes you keep looking.
Unclaimed Meeting Minutes | Recorded all the nonsense, but not your hard work.
Keyboard Crumbs | The unsightly legacy of your lunch.
Low Toner Warning | Much like your nearly extinguished fighting spirit.
Unread Shared Cloud | Filled with your talent that no one cares about.
Mouse Double-click Failure | Dropping efficiency by 1%; a tiny revenge.
Dead Pixel on Screen | Like the bloodshot in your eyes, small and stubborn.
Expired Antivirus | Can't protect your soul from being eroded by work.
PC Fan Noise | The only sound in this office actually trying.
Unopened E-card | Hypocritical blessings are worse than this poop.
Reflection on Screen | Seeing your own face longing for freedom.
Old ID Card Photo | The you in the photo had light; now there's only dark circles.
PC Blue Light | Simulating the aurora, fooling your brain into thinking it's on vacation.
Dry Faucet | A reminder that this firm won't even give you water anymore.
wealth_tiny: Toilet Paper (2 sheets) | Company thanks you for helping deplete inventory.
Copy Paper (1 sheet) | Fold it into a paper airplane, you earned it.
Paperclip | Good for poking the reset button, otherwise useless.
Pen Ink (0.5cc) | Every grain counts. Squat a thousand more times to buy a whole pen.
Non-sticky Post-it | Much like your loyalty to the firm, a light breeze will blow it away.
Rusty Staple | It might prick you, but it represents your tiny rebellion against the system.
Dried-up Pen Ink | It's a blessing; now you have a reason not to write that report.
Broken Rubber Band | Used to be tense, now as limp as your soul after work.
Soggy Coaster Left by a Colleague | It's wet, but it's the only territorial expansion you have.
Half a Pencil | Short, but enough to write your resignation letter (if you dared).
Uncapped Marker | Its drying out foreshadows the limit of your passion for this job.
Hole Punch Confetti | These are your dreams shredded by the company; colorful but useless.
Plastic Stirring Stick | Perfect for stirring your murky career plans.
Bent Paperclip | It's been bent by life, just like you.
A Fraying Rubber Band | Stretched to its limit, much like your patience with this job.
Non-sticky Post-it | What's falling isn't paper; it's your insignificant loyalty.
Rusty Staple | It might prick you, but it represents your tiny rebellion against the system.
Half a Pencil | Short, but enough to write your resignation letter (if you dared).
Hole Punch Confetti | These are your dreams shredded by the company; colorful but useless.
Uncapped Marker | Its drying out foreshadows the limit of your passion for this job.
Soggy Coaster Left by a Colleague | It's wet, but it's the only territorial expansion you have besides your desk.
Plastic Stirring Stick | Perfect for stirring your murky career plans.
Bent Paperclip | It's been bent by life, just like you.
Printer Paper Wrapper | It's trash, but it once wrapped the company's core secrets.
Dried-up Pen Ink | It's a blessing; now you have a reason not to write that report.
Blue Pen (Still works) | It can help you sign papers, but it can't help you sign a check.
Old Charging Cable (Loose connection) | Like your energy, it only works at a specific angle.
A Small Piece of String | Enough to hang your hopes on, though it could break anytime.
Misprinted Annual Goals | Doesn't matter; you won't achieve them next year anyway.
Rusty Binder Clip | Gripping your attendance sheet, but failing to stop time.
Expired Office Snacks | They taste terrible, but it's the only calories you didn't pay for.
A Broken Ruler | Making it impossible to measure the distance between you and success.
Dried-up Highlighter | Can't mark the points because your life has no point.
Yellow Chick Sticker from a Street Promo | Stick it on your PC to pretend you still have a childhood.
Warm Tea Egg | It once had wings to fly; now it's soy-braised and yours to eat.
Freshly Replaced Water Cooler Tank | You drank the freshest (company-paid) water of the day.
Gum Shared by a Colleague | Chew it and pretend this is the sweetness of life.
Ragged Bag with Company Logo | Advertising for the firm in exchange for tiny psychological comfort.
Expired Staff Trip Brochure | Look at the places you can't go; reminisce about the leave you didn't take.
Snack Crumbs Stolen from a Colleague | Small, but stolen things always taste better.
Lighter with no Fluid | Can't light a cigarette, just like you can't light your passion for the future.
Mask Strap with no Elasticity | Tight on your ears, tight on your right to breathe free.
A Blank CD-ROM | Filled with the digital age's forgotten tears.
Keyboard Mat with a Broken Leg | Making your typing wobbly, just like your position.
Broken PC Cooling Fan | It's screaming, expressing your rage towards overtime.
Wet Ink Pad Smudge | It stamped your promise, but it'll blur soon.
Invisible Tape End | Never finding the start, much like your never-ending tasks.
Expired Product Catalog | Full of outdated tech and your outdated dreams.
Dried Correction Fluid | Can't erase your mistakes, only leaving white scars.
Withered Succulent from a Colleague | Drying up in the AC; it's a warning to you.
Non-sticky Double-sided Tape | Barely holding your dignity together, liable to snap.
Little Paper Circles from the Hole Punch | They fly free; you have to stay put.
Red Pen (Still works) | A screen full of edits; the painful price of your alchemy.
Broken Tape Measure | The things that won't retract are the tape and your overtime.
Expired Christmas Decorations | In a January office, mocking the holidays you missed.
Unclaimed Disposable Chopsticks | Your final utensil for fighting capitalism.
Dust Bunny under the Monitor | Six months of workplace resentment, small and solid.
Expired Flu Medicine Packet | Taken so you could work, but won't cure your boredom with it.
Comb with Broken Teeth | Won't smooth your hair, won't smooth your anxious heart.
Dried Whiteboard Marker | Wrote your ideas, then promptly vanished into thin air.
Transparent Trash Bag | Holding your labor, easily discarded by the company.
Broken '=' Key on a Calculator | Never getting a result; that's your current situation.
Spiritual Protection Snacks (Expired) | Praying the system won't crash, and you won't either.
Uncapped Glue | Stuck to your hand, but can't stick to your desire to escape.
wealth_low: Convenience Store Tea Egg | Protein is the foundation of revolution. Watch your cholesterol.
Yakult | Drink it, promote digestion, start the next alchemy cycle.
Instant Noodles | Crush it like you're crushing your boss's dreams.
Plastic Bag ($0.07) | What are you putting in it? Your salary.
Cold Milk Tea | A catalyst for your bowels and your passport to escape the desk.
Crumbled Instant Noodle Scraps | The salty taste of the reluctant tears you've shed.
Non-winning Scratch-off | It didn't win, but it gave you five minutes of 'getting rich' dreams at work.
Free Promo Tissues | Perfect for wiping away tears; don't let HR see your vulnerability.
Five-dollar Supermarket Coupon | To save five dollars, you'll walk three miles. That's life.
Half-eaten Convenience Store Bread | Stale, but it's energy bought with your soul.
Extra Tapioca Pearls for $5 | The only 'value-add' you've achieved in the company today.
A Warm Tea Egg | It once had wings to fly, now it's just soy-braised and yours to eat.
Freshly Replaced Water Cooler Tank | You drank the freshest (company-paid) water of the day.
Gum Shared by a Colleague | Chew it and pretend this is the sweetness of life.

Cold Milk Tea | A catalyst for your bowels and your passport to escape the desk.
Discounted Onigiri | The rice is a bit hard, but it's your last fortress against inflation.
Rain-soaked Newspaper | Unreadable, but place it under your feet to soak up workplace humidity.
Reward Stickers (x2) | Only 98 more to get that plate. Keep going, Alchemist.
The Aroma of the Microwave | It's not your lunch, but smelling it is free.
Expired Bento Flyer | Look at the pictures and pretend you just had a feast.
Wedding Cookie Crumbs | Sharing someone else's joy to mask your own emptiness.
Buy-1-Get-1 Canned Coffee | Double the caffeine, double the overtime energy.
Unwanted Year-end Party Gift | It's an ugly pillow, but it's your bed at the office now.
Plastic Grocery Bag | Walking down the street, carrying your poverty with pride.
Promo Fan from a Cram School | Fanning away office heat, but not the boss's nonsense.
Tea Egg Shell Fragments | No meat, but the scent of soy sauce is the dignity you deserve.
Flat Soda | Sweet, but the passion is long gone.
Disposable Raincoat | It leaks, but at least it blocks the manager's spit.
Non-winning Receipt | You possessed the dream of being a millionaire for five seconds.
A Small Roll of Bubble Wrap | Pop it and listen to the sound of capitalism crumbling.
Expired Shopping Points | To earn this much, you might need to poop 500 more times.
Tap Water with Ice | Pretending it's a cocktail on a seaside vacation.
A Bite of a Colleague's Snack | Just one bite, but stolen things always taste better.
Lighter with no Fluid | Can't light a cigarette, just like you can't light your passion for the future.
Broken Tape Measure | The things that won't retract are the tape and your overtime.

Broken '=' Key on a Calculator | Never getting a result; that's your current situation.
Spiritual Protection Snacks (Expired) | Praying the system won't crash, and you won't either.
Uncapped Glue | Stuck to your hand, but can't stick to your desire to escape.
Discounted Instant Noodles | The broth is salty, but that's the taste of your dignity.
Sample Lotion from a Promo | Apply it to pretend the dry office air doesn't affect you.
Second-hand Magazine | Flipping through last year's trends, living a delayed life.
Dried Correction Fluid | Can't erase your mistakes, only leaving white scars.
Deformed Paper Cup | Carrying your reliance on the company, wobbling.
Broken Nail Clippers | Messy and hard to trim, just like your project progress.
Empty Lighter Flint | No fire, but it's the only weight in your pocket.
Expired Movie Coupon | Look at the date; remember the movie you missed due to overtime.
Withered Succulent from a Colleague | Drying up in the AC; it's a warning to you.
Eco-friendly Bag with a Weird Logo | At least it's green, even with the strange branding.
wealth_mid_low: Iced Milk Tea (with pearls) | The price of the breakfast shop auntie calling you handsome.
Fried Chicken (uncut) | It's expensive now, but you traded poop for it.
Netflix Basic Plan | Watch shows at work, double alchemy, double happiness.
Bubble Tea (less sugar, less ice) | This is the blood pack for corporate slaves.
wealth_mid: Chicken Leg Bento (with egg) | You earned today's lunch money in the bathroom.
Taxi Base Fare | Escape this company now, just go.
Movie Ticket (matinee) | Pretend to meet a client, actually meeting Tom Cruise.
Cheap Bluetooth Earbuds | Can't hear the boss's nonsense = good earbuds.
wealth_high: High-Speed Rail Ticket (non-reserved) | Enough to escape to another city and start over.
Massage Voucher (30 min) | Your shoulders are stiff, but your life is stiffer.
Gacha Pull (one 10-pull) | Thanks boss for sponsoring your gacha money.
Premium Steak (business lunch) | Eating better than the boss, that's winning.
wealth_ultra: Boss's Blood Pressure Meds | You made the company stock drop 0.00001%.
Ergonomic Chair (with headrest) | If you're going to prison, at least sit comfortably.
Therapy Session (1 hour) | You need more than money, you need a doctor.
wealth_legendary: Philosopher's Stone (Kidney Stone) | Are you sure you're okay in there? Should I call an ambulance?
Company Ownership (0.01%) | Congrats, you're a shareholder now.
Breath of Freedom | What you earned isn't money, it's dignity.
wealth_overlord: Company Ownership Certificate | This poop's value exceeds the firm's net worth. Acquisition successful.
The Chairman's Solid Gold Throne | Diamond-encrusted; even the flush sounds like a symphony.
Hostile Takeover Proposal | You're now the majority shareholder; the Boss is making your coffee.
Global Toilet Patent | From now on, everyone on Earth owes you a 0.01% royalty per flush.
HR Dissolution Order | You can buy the whole department and send them to deliver takeout.
The Boss's Personal Chauffeur | They're waiting outside the stall to drive you to a feast.
Rooftop Helipad Rights | You don't have a chopper, but it's a great place to dry your checks.
Gold-leaf Toilet Paper | Every sheet is 24K gold; watch out for chafing on your royal backside.
Building Naming Rights | Tomorrow, the HQ will be officially renamed '(Your Name) Alchemy Tower'.
Chairman of the Global Slacker Guild | Your name will be etched on the Wall of Honor in the Toilet Museum.
The Boss's Retirement Fund | What you earned in a minute is enough to send the Boss home for good.
Private Elevator (Stall Direct) | A custom lift installed just for your alchemy efficiency.
Permanent Leave Warrant | No need to ask for leave; you effectively own the company now.
Corporate PR Crisis | News broke of your bathroom gold mine; stock rose 200% instantly.
100% Board Voting Rights | Your word is law; dissenters will be sent to scrub the floors.
Global Water Resource Control | Every drop you flush is merely washing your vast wealth.
The Boss's Termination Notice | Good job, Boss. From today, you can stay home and rest.
Private Satellite Broadcast Rights | Announce to the universe: I just pooped a fortune.
Keys to the Corporate Retreat | That's your private nap room now. No more hiding in stalls.
Solid Gold Punch Clock | Custom-made for you, even though you don't need to clock in anymore.
Finance Department's SOS | You're earning so fast, three of our computers just caught fire.
Infinite Petty Cash Access | Money is just a number; the office is now your personal ATM.
The Boss's Executive Parking Spot | Park your bike there; nobody will dare say a word.
Structural Load Test Report | The gold you've minted is so heavy, the floor is about to collapse.
Global Heated Toilet Seat Treaty | For your dignity, every seat on Earth stays at a constant 38¬∞C.
HR Record Destruction Order | All your late arrivals have vanished into ash. You are perfect.
The Boss's Blood Pressure Meds (Life Contract) | Your existence requires them to keep a lifeline handy.
Life-size Statue in the Lobby | To commemorate your miracle, a monument will stand at the entrance.
Ultimate Guarantee of Freedom | You'll never have to answer to anyone again, except the toilet.
The True Philosopher's Stone | You've reached the pinnacle of alchemy: turning waste into pure gold.

landing.title: Welcome back, Alchemist.
landing.subtitle: Don't let HR see the magic.
